intro: Hieracium mairanum, commonly known as the Mairanum hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers in clustered heads. The plant is native to Europe and is often found in grassy areas, meadows, and disturbed soils. It has a fibrous root system and is known for its ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Hieracium mairanum is typically found in temperate climates and is relatively hardy, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
